other_tests.findings: A novel heterozygous mutation (F180C) in exon 4 of the CASR gene was identified, which was unresponsive to increases in extracellular calcium concentrations.
Vitamin D supplementation resulted in a reduction of serum PTH levels to the normal range while serum calcium remained moderately elevated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Throughout the supplementation, serum PTH levels fell into the normal range, and serum 25(OH)D levels rose, but serum and ionized calcium levels stayed constant at moderately elevated levels.

other_tests.findings: The newborn presented with mildly elevated calcium, markedly elevated PTH and osteocalcin levels, and a 25(OH)D level of 26.2 nmol/liter.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Serum PTH levels decreased over time as the hyperparathyroidism resolved; PTH levels were slightly elevated at day 48 and within normal range at day 70.
